resources.string: Coronary heart disease(CHD), is the leading cause of death both in the UK and worldwide. Each year, about 1 in 6 men and 1 in 10 women in the UK die from CHD. CHD is caused by the build up of fatty material inside the artery walls. This build up of fat narrows the artery walls and may cause a blood clot to form. If it blocks the coronary artery and cuts off the supply of oxygen-rich blood to your heart muscle, your heart may become permanently damanged. This is known as a heart attack. Learn more: http://tinyurl.com/prbsx65

Inherited conditions can be passed on through families. They can affect many parts of the body or cause many different conditions and are sometimes called genetic heart conditions. Inherited heart conditions can cause heart rhythm disturbances, cardiomyopathies (enlarged heart) and very high cholesterol levels. These conditions can lead to strokes, heart failure and heart attacks. Learn more: http://tinyurl.com/zjunaq9

In 2013 we took a major step towards mending broken hearts when we committed to funding four pioneering Centres of Regenerative Medicine at top UK universities. The universities involved are working on finding ways to grow new blood vessels to replace those damanged by a heart attack, developing ways to grow patches of heart tissue from stem cells that could be used to repair damaged hearts and understanding how the heart might be taught to repair itself after the damage of a heart attack. Learn more: http://tinyurl.com/z8y476r

An irregular pulse could be a sign that you have an abnormal heart rhythm. Atrial Fibrillation (AF) is one of the most common forms of abnormal heart rhythm and it is a major cause of strokes. AF can be inherited from birth but it can also be linked to come from high blood pressure, heart valve disease, overactive thyroid gland and excessive alcohol consumption. Learn more: http://tinyurl.com/zw96qwc

Cardiomyopathy is a disease of the heart muscle. It can run in families and can affect one or several members of a family. Some members of a family may be affected more than others and some family members may not be affected or have any symptons at all. Cardiomyopathy changes the size of your heart and can also affect the way the electrical system makes your heart beat. Learn more: http://tinyurl.com/m2639pb

Sepsis is a life-threatening condition caused by infection and it leads to more than 100,000 people being admitted to UK hospitals every year. Around 37% of those admitted to hospital die in hospital. The BHF is funding research into L-257 a revelutionary new drug which, if development progresses at its current rate will be a drug in circulaation mid 2017 successful, will be in production in 2017.
